chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction
Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Klatt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Good faith effort to obtain/maintain fulltime employment/schooling or combination thereof.
No contact with victim D.W. unless as approved by PO.

Safe Program completion. 
Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. 
Defendant is eligible for SAP but is not eligible for CIP.
Payment of any costs/fees that remain unpaid from Marathon County cases 2013CF606 and 2013CF890.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.
